subject: Marketing
title: The Persuasion Paradox
description: A fast breakdown of The Persuasion Paradox for builders.

hook.text: You think you choose products rationally. Neuroscience says 95% of decisions happen unconsciously.

buildup.text: Marketers know this. They target emotions, identity, and social pressureâ€”not logic.

discovery.text: Persuasion works best when the audience doesn't realize it's happening.

twist.text: The most persuaded people are those who insist they can't be influenced.

climax.text: Awareness doesn't make you immune. It makes you a more conscious consumer.

punchline.text: The best persuasion feels like your own idea.

quiz.question: What percentage of purchase decisions happen unconsciously according to neuroscience?
